oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Conservation of natural resources
Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); New Deal, 1933-1939
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fifteen unidentified Civilian Conservation Corps workers digging at the side of a road.
Tennessee was in the Fourth Corps Area, and along with portions of western North Carolina, Northern Georgia, Alabama, and Mississippi composed District C.
